description: Conduct biological (through vertical plankton hauls) and physical oceanographic (through CTD and water sampling) monitoring at 30 stations in Strait of Georgia, providing a safe and appropriate vessel and crew for up to 30 oceanographic stations. Accommodations for 2 science crew members required. Has contract been awarded? TRUE
full_summary:
=====================================

### [Salish Sea Plankton Survey - Multi-Day Vessel Charter]^

#### Request for Proposal (RFP) | Demande de Propositions

**Reference Number:** | cb-781-53346328 
**Title:** | Salish Sea Plankton Survey - Multi-Day Vessel Charter
**Publication Date:** | October 20, 2023

#### Procurement Overview

Fisheries and Oceans Canada invites contractors to submit bids for a multi-day vessel charter for a plankton survey in the Salish Sea. The successful bidder will provide a safe and suitable vessel, as well as a competent crew, to conduct biological and physical oceanographic monitoring at up to 30 stations throughout the Strait of Georgia.

#### Vessel Requirements

-   A crane and/or A-frame and winch are required for the vessel.
-   The vessel must be in good condition and compliant with relevant regulations.
-   Accommodation and workspace must be provided for a minimum of two science crew members.

#### Monitoring Activities

-   Biological monitoring: vertical plankton hauls at up to 30 stations.
-   Physical oceanographic monitoring: CTD casts and water sampling at select depths.
-   Retrieval and deployment of up to 30 plankton nets (BONGO or SCOR net).

#### Location

The survey will take place in the waters around the east coast of Vancouver Island, Strait of Georgia, from Sidney BC (including Haro Strait) in the south up to Comox in the north.

#### Documents

The full RFP document is available at: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/22747/30004493---rfp.pdf>

#### Contact Information

Cal LaKing
DFO.Tenders-Soumissions.MPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca 
(506) 478-3581

Schedule
------------------

*   **Tender Closing Date:** November 6, 2023, 1:00 PM
*   **Expected Contract Start Date:** November 17, 2023
*   **Expected Contract End Date:** September 30, 2024
